processed.result:
You are given $n$ cups of tea to drink, $a$ of which are green and $b$ of which are black ($a+b=n$). You cannot drink more than $k$ cups of the same type of tea in a row.  

Determine if it is possible to drink all $n$ cups of tea without violating the rule, and if so, output a sequence of 'G's and 'B's representing the order in which to drink the tea. If it is impossible, output "NO".

You have a certain number of cups of tea to drink. You also have a certain number of green tea bags and black tea bags. You can't drink the same type of tea more than a certain number of times in a row.  Can you arrange the tea bags so you can drink all the cups of tea without breaking the rule? If so, show the order. If not, say "no".
